page.title: 14SELATTYN TOWER
page.content: Selattyn tower can be found at grid 267/343 it stands on Selattyn hill about 371 metres above sea level Its only 3 metres high now, it has partly tumbled down . Its made of stone and it was used for a watch tower during the Second World War. It was made for a rector, it was called a folley it is 3m70 ems wide and it was about 5 metres high from the tower you can see right over the Shropshire plain. It is 1 mile from Selattyn school to the tower. There are many footpaths and bridleways which cross our area. Selattyn tower is a favourite beauty spot for visitors and local people.
